title: (x) Max Lucado delicate serif logo - Requiem Fine {Patricia}
content:
I need help with a proper ID of this font. I can get close but the curved serifs I can't get. Help?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110423185858im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Max_3490.gif)
author: Tonie Blaze

comments.content: Nope - it's Requiem Fine Roman from H&FJ

Requiem Fine Small Caps, actually

link: [http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_styles.php?productLineID=100020](http://web.archive.org/web/20110423185858/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_styles.php?productLineID=100020 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_styles.php?productLineID=100020")
Just looked it up online. You nailed it. Thanks!

It's Requiem, but it's probably supposed to be Trajan. I used to work for a company that published Max Lucado's books, and official policy was that his name would always be set in Trajan. But that was some three years ago, and corporate policy changes pretty quickly.
I guess they thought the name Requiem was more appropriate for a minister.
